json.text: This is Mark from MarkTeacher.com with another IELTS speaking question and
answer. This IELTS speaking question is about marriage. What's the perfect age
for marriage? These days I don't think there is a perfect age anymore, but there
probably is an ideal situation when people should consider getting married.
The ideal situation would probably be being financially secure or having some
savings in the bank to pay for the wedding first of all. As well as that,
they should consider their career. I think they should have a stable career
or a job that they can rely on to provide for them in the foreseeable
future. If they meet those two criteria, then I think that sounds absolutely
ideal - there's nothing stopping two people getting married and making quite
a radical, drastic change to their lifestyles. I don't think people are
getting married later because there's an age or number they're trying to avoid, but
I think people are more invested in their own futures before they start to
commit to somebody else or decide to settle down with a partner. Check out
MarkTeacher.com for more IELTS courses lessons and tips!
